TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RangeType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of numeric comparison to use in an instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression> enumeration is used to indicate whether a value is between two specified values. The enumeration is used in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MinType%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression.MaxType%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeExpression> class.
You specify a minimum and a maximum value. You can include or exclude values that you specified by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType> class.
The following table describes the enumeration values.
|Enumeration|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |None|Specifies that the search does not have a boundary.| |Inclusive|Performs a greater-than-or-less-than comparison. Corresponds to the >= or \<= operation.| |Exclusive|Performs a greater-than-or-less-than comparison. Corresponds to the > or < operation.|
## Examples The following example shows how to search the ListPrice column in the Products table of the AdventureWorks database for products that have a list price in the range specified in the `FromTextBox` and `ToTextBox` text boxes. The filter includes the specified minimum value in search results by using the Inclusive property but excludes the specified maximum value. This code example is part of a larger example provided in [Walkthrough: Filtering Data in a Web Page Using Declarative Syntax](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b305ae31-1a1b-4d07-a678-51457c17614f).
``` <asp:RangeExpression DataField="ListPrice" MinType="Inclusive" MaxType="Exclusive"> <asp:ControlParameter ControlID="FromTextBox" /> <asp:ControlParameter ControlID="ToTextBox" /> </asp:RangeExpression> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType Exclusive = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies a greater-than-or-less-than comparison. Corresponds to the or operator.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType Inclusive = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies an equal-to-or-greater-than comparison or an equal-to-or-less-than comparison. Corresponds to the or operator.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.RangeType None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the search does not have a boundary.
